pr_title: Fix issue in arrow expression type checking in sort

timeline.message: Fix issue in arrow expression type checking in sort

timeline.bodyText: Can you please explain what we're trying to do with this block? Is there a sample invocation?
timeline.author: MaryamZi

replies.author: lasinicl

replies.bodyText:
Shall we add a comment explaining why we're doing it? Also it's not just an arrow function right? There can even be a normal function with a compatible union type as the return type?
A union should have at least 2 members. If it has only 2, don't we have to change elemType?
Can't sortArr or sortArr[0] be empty here?
replies.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText:
Added a comment. That condition checking was only added for arrow functions. When it's an arrow function we definitely know that the function return type is a union with more than 2 member types.  In other cases if return type is a union it can contain maximum of two members. Thus this condition is checked if (elemType.getTag() == TypeTags.UNION_TAG && ((BUnionType) elemType).getMemberTypes().size() > 2) and the type of values in sortArr is taken.
This is already handled in 
  
    
      ballerina-lang/langlib/lang.array/src/main/java/org/ballerinalang/langlib/array/Sort.java
    
    
         Line 92
      in
      4fc6993
    
    
    
    

        
          
           if (elemType.getTag() == TypeTags.UNION_TAG) { 
        
    
  


yes. therefore changed the position of the condition checking for arrow functions
